name: clearCanvas()
content: Just like you can delete all the data in a document, App Lab provides a way to clear the active canvas. Clearing a canvas is typically done after some event, so that whatever was drawn has a chance to be seen before it is erased. Examples below will make use of [setTimeout](/docs/applab/setTimeout) and [onEvent](/docs/applab/onEvent) to more clearly demonstrate clearCanvas.

examples.name: Example: Clear a square
Example: Time Out
examples.description: **Example: Time Out** Draw a square and then erase it in three seconds using [setTimeout](/docs/applab/setTimeout).

examples.name: Example: Change the Smile
examples.description: **Example: Change the Smile** Draw a new mouth where you click.

return_value: No return value. Alters the display only.
short_description: Clears all data on the active canvas.
tips:
- Only the active canvas is cleared.
- Clearing the active canvas may reveal hidden drawing on a canvas that was behind the active canvas.
